channel.title: Comments on: 5 Books Every Developer Should Read
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Roger Dickey
item.dc:creator: Roger Dickey
item.description: I'd add "Coder to Developer" by Mike Gunderloy.
item.content:encoded: I’d add “Coder to Developer” by Mike Gunderloy.

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.content:encoded:
ZagNut,

Dreaming in Code is on my list, hope to get to it soon ðŸ™‚

item.title: By: ZagNut
item.dc:creator: ZagNut
item.content:encoded:
Two others that are good from a “project-management perspective”:

Brook’s Mythical Man Month, and Dreaming in Code.

The latter is an excellent way to view third-hand the maddening frustration of a horribly managed / designed (large) scale software project.

Books like these can help just as much as “pure” design books, by helping one develop their “expectations” intuition.

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.description: Like I said..."The books that I have chosen are not specific to any language"
item.content:encoded: Like I said…”The books that I have chosen are not specific to any language”
